testcase.name: Aspect rules in Formulae. Static Analysis
testcase.description: if a source contains the QName of a fact variable that binds to a sequence unless the formula uses implicit filtering and the aspect rule addresses an aspect that is not covered by a filter for the fact variable then an error MUST be thrown.

variation.name: sequence SAV conflicts implicit filtering false
variation.description: The source v:liabilities for the formula without implicit filtering produces a sequence of facts for liabilities, one for period 2007 and another for 2006. The period aspect of the result uses liabilities (the sequence) for its result. In a draft of the formula spec this would have caused a sequence conflicts error, but not in the REC version (see http://wiki.xbrl.org/wiki/Formula_CR_2#2009-04-08_Hitoshi_Okumura:_The_definition_of_xbrlfe:sequenceSAVConflicts_should_be_modified_not_to_refer_implicit_filtering ). Thus, though a static test, the variation now is expected to produce a result.

variation.name: sequence SAV conflicts implicit filtering true
variation.description: Implicit filtering is used in this testcase, but there's a period filter for liabilities to allow the liabilties sequence to pass for both context years. The source for the period aspect rule is v:liabilities which produces SAV conflicts regardless of the use of implicitFiltering=true, because the period aspect filter is covered (here exemplifying multiple conflicting values).
